references.paper_title: Badnets: Evaluating backdooring attacks on deep neural networks
references.reason: This paper is foundational in the field of backdoor attacks, introducing the concept and evaluation methodology for such attacks, providing a baseline for subsequent research.
This paper proposes a dynamic backdoor attack method which enhances the stealthiness of backdoor attacks, improving upon previous static methods.
This paper introduces a novel backdoor attack that uses image warping to create highly stealthy backdoor triggers, pushing the boundaries of backdoor attack sophistication.

references.paper_title: Bppattack: Stealthy and efficient trojan attacks against deep neural networks via image quantization and contrastive adversarial learning
references.reason: This paper presents a backdoor attack that uses image quantization and contrastive learning, offering a new approach that combines techniques for improved stealthiness and effectiveness.

references.paper_title: Revisiting the assumption of latent separability for backdoor defenses
references.reason: This paper challenges a common assumption in backdoor defense, improving understanding and potentially leading to more robust defenses against such attacks.
